column4: hi...i tried to install ubuntu live support utility but ./configure returned that it cant find install-sh or install.h although they were present in the directory, what am i doing wrong?
did you install build-essential?
how do i do that?
sudo apt-get install build-essential
yeah they were already installed....the build-essential that is
what are you trying to install?
ubuntu live support ... wait to find the link
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuLiveChatSupport
what one are you trying to install the 1st or 2nd tar?
emm....there is only one tar hosted there
why i see 2?
dunno....drunk maybe ? :P
did you get it extracted yet?
yeap
also can you please install checkinstall
once its unpacked and your ready to continue please cd ubuntu <tab> that should put you install the file tar just made
checkinstall from apt-get?
ok done
cant install it it is broken i have this feeling they are not done with it
oh ok...sorry for the trouble
i just wanted learn how to properly install packages....so ./configure, make , make install should install it when its done right?
that prject isnt finished i have it in my dapper menu and that doesnt work yet either
